title: Biden promises to defend social programmes in Florida speech
description: US president has accused Republican Party members of threatening to cut programmes like Medicare and Social Security.

title: Poland to close Belarus border crossing after journalist jailed
description: Announcement comes after a Belarusian court sentenced a journalist of Polish origin to eight years in prison.

title: Death toll climbs above 20,000 after Turkey-Syria earthquake
description: Human rights groups criticised the timing, content of UN aid delivered to northwest Syria three days after the quakes.

title: Arrested as a Chinese spy, former New York cop seeks answers
description: Baimadajie Angwang says he wants to be reinstated to police force after US prosecutors drop charges against him.

title: Australia eye three-peat at Women’s T20 Cricket World Cup
description: The defending champions are overwhelming favourites to win the 20-over tournament that begins in South Africa on Friday.

title: What can be done to curb global food price rises?
description: World food costs have hit a record high and are destabilising societies around the globe.

title: Italy prime minister irked by ‘inappropriate’ Zelenskyy meeting
description: Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni says French-German meeting with the Ukrainian leader in Paris did help 'unity'.

title: Ukrainian rescuers fly in from war zone to save lives in Turkey
description: Kyiv sends 88 people to Turkey to help with a disaster that has killed more than 20,000 people there and in Syria.

title: Burt Bacharach, legendary composer of pop songs, dies at 94
description: Award-winning composer is known for tunes such as Alfie, Walk on By and Raindrops Keep Fallin' on My Head.

title: Ukraine’s president says Europe has promised jets as UK hesitates
description: Volodymyr Zelenskyy wraps up whistle-stop wartime trip aimed at securing additional arms from the West.

title: Chinese balloon was ‘clearly for intelligence surveillance’: US
description: State Department says device had multiple antennas 'likely capable of collecting and geo-locating communications'.

title: Leaving Afghanistan: Starting over in a new land
description: We follow a female school principal and a student who’ve fled Taliban rule in Afghanistan to start new lives in Canada.

title: Nicaragua frees 222 political prisoners, now heading to US
description: Release welcomed as 'excellent' news amid Nicaraguan government's crackdown on opposition figures and critics.

title: Russia’s Lavrov visits Sudan on diplomatic push in Africa’s Sahel
description: Lavrov arrived in Khartoum seeking to bolster the two countries’ economic ties, especially in infrastructure.

title: Ukraine slams Roger Waters over UN Security Council speech
description: The Pink Floyd star argued that Russia's invasion of Ukraine was provoked during an address to diplomats in New York.

title: Middle East roundup: Devastating earthquakes in Turkey and Syria
description: Here’s a roundup of Al Jazeera’s Middle East coverage this week.

title: Palestinians extend a helping hand to quake-hit Turkey and Syria
description: Rescuers from the occupied Palestinian territories are joining international efforts to bring quake survivors to safety.

title: Explainer: How do earthquakes happen?
description: These terrifying events raise many questions; here are some answers.

title: Barcelona mayor cuts ties with Israel, citing Palestinian rights
description: The left-wing mayor of Barcelona has called on Israel to end the 'systematic violation' of Palestinian human rights.

title: ‘One of a kind’: Radhouane Slimane and Tunisia’s basketball boom
description: Tunisian basketball star Radhouane Slimane looks to defy the odds and his age as US Monastir play at the FIBA ICC.

title: Lula goes to Washington eyeing a ‘new era’ in US-Brazil relations
description: Brazil's president will join Joe Biden for talks in US capital Friday amid political turmoil, deep divisions at home.

title: Big Oil’s Big Lies: How the industry denied global warming
description: How and why the oil industry downplayed climate change.

title: Why did so many buildings collapse in Turkey?
description: A combination of factors led to the widespread destruction that has left thousands still trapped under debris.

title: Biden says US not seeking conflict with China after balloon saga
description: The downing of the alleged Chinese spy balloon has caused a diplomatic row between Washington and Beijing.

title: Russia attacks east Ukraine as milestone nears; Kyiv seeks arms
description: In the 50th week of war, clashes intensify along eastern front lines, as Kyiv claims heavy losses among Russian troops.

title: Does the US support France’s idea for ‘strategic autonomy’?
description: Despite some attempts to set itself apart from US policies, France is falling more in line with Washington.

title: In South Africa, ‘load shedding’ takes a toll on small businesses
description: Small business owners say the scheduled power cuts are hurting their daily operations.

title: Kagame’s achievements should not blind us to his tyranny
description: Rwanda's president is not a 'pioneer' worthy of 'adulation'.

title: Four killed by magnitude 5.4 earthquake in Indonesia’s Papua
description: Buildings were damaged and at least four people killed when a cafe collapsed into the sea, authorities say.

title: First UN aid since quake crosses into northwest Syria from Turkey
description: Six trucks have crossed into northwestern Syria from Turkey for the first time since the earthquake on Monday.

title: Australia strips Chinese-made security cameras from defence sites
description: Australian Defence Minister said Chinese-made cameras will be removed to ensure the security of ministry buildings.

title: Eritrea persecuted relatives of military draft dodgers – HRW
description: The rights group said authorities arbitrarily detained relatives of those who evaded forced conscription.

title: Inflation and recession: Can the world defeat both in 2023?
description: No, it must accept one, per conventional wisdom. But Europe’s showing another way, though it won’t be painless either.

title: Confusion over footballer Christian Atsu’s safety in Turkey
description: Ghanaian winger's Turkish club, Hatayspor, say he remains missing following the quake, denying reports he was rescued.

title: Indian gov’t says hug cows on Valentine’s Day, Twitter cracks up
description: Animal welfare department appeals to mark February 14 this year not as a celebration of romance but as 'Cow Hug Day'.

title: North Korea shows off nuclear arsenal at night-time parade
description: Kim Jong Un and his daughter took centre stage at a military parade featuring North Korea's latest nuclear missiles.

title: Russia-Ukraine war tests unity of Spain’s left-wing government
description: Spain's ruling Socialists back arming Kyiv but their junior coalition partner, Podemos, remains unconvinced.

title: Hope turns to despair in Turkey, Syria 72 hours after earthquakes
description: While dramatic rescues continue, hopes recede of finding many more survivors amid freezing cold and lack of resources.

title: Some Twitter users unable to post as platform hit by glitch

title: More Kenyans hit by climate change count on fish farming
description: An increasing number of farmers are surviving drought and downpours by supplementing their income by raising fish.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 351

title: India’s Adani shares fall after MSCI review of free-float status
description: US-based stock index provider determines some Adani Group securities should no longer be designated as free float.

description: Persistent load shedding has South Africans calling for a new approach to energy.

title: Real Madrid beat Al Ahly 4-1 to reach Club World Cup final
description: Madrid thrashed the Egyptian side to set up a clash with Saudi Arabia's Al Hilal in Saturday’s final in Rabat, Morocco.

title: North Korea shows off possible new ICBM at huge military parade
description: The parade in Pyongyang appeared to feature a new, solid-fuel intercontinental ballistic missile, analysts said.

title: How Behrouz Boochani is changing the narrative on refugees
description: Kurdish-Iranian writer and author spent six years in detention on Manus Island after trying to get to Australia by boat.

description: Investigators say while the chain of command to the Russian president is clear, he has immunity as head of state.

title: Report slams police as ‘unprofessional’ in Tyre Nichols beating

title: Two US Army veterans win citizenship after deportation to Mexico
description: The Biden administration has taken steps to bring back dozens of former military members who had been deported.

title: Balloon ‘panic’ intensifies push against China in Washington
description: Biden administration faces growing calls from US Congress for tough policies against China after 'spy' balloon incident.
